result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn D McDaniel Sr

records.addlTxt: Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
Br. 7

11:18 AM Defendant Glenn McDaniel Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Glenn McDaniel Sr.  Attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State calls witness Detective A. D. who is duly sworn and testified. Atty. Al-Homsi with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Moyers with cross. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC for BO.
and returned.
Preliminary hearing on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 10/18/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $50,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services immediately following his release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alex E, Keith S, or Alexandra T.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
_x_ Regardless of when cash bail (if required) is posted, or when a signature bond is signed, the jail shall only release the defendant if the defendant can arrive at Pretrial Services between the hours of 8 am and 3 pm (Monday through Friday) unless the jail has cleared a later arrival time directly with Pretrial Services. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services - Amended

*** IN CUSTODY ***

9:05 AM Defendant Glenn McDaniel Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Glenn McDaniel Sr.  ADA Kyle Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Moyers has now been appointed and requested a preliminary hearing be scheduled. Defn has previously waived time limits for preliminary hearing.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

9:05 AM Defendant Glenn McDaniel Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter R. Moyers in court for Glenn McDaniel Sr.  ADA Kyle Olson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Re: Motion to Modify Bail
Statement by Attorney Moyers requesting reduction in cash bail. Objection by ADA Olsen for reduction in bail. Court reduces bail to $50,000 and adds Dane County Pretrial Services for Random Drug Testing and GPS Monitoring. All other conditions remain the same.

10/18/22 - Amended Minutes
-Also added condition of Defendant shall not possess or consume controlled substances without a valid prescription. 

Abby H.
Atty Peter Moyers appointed 10-12-22
Bail/bond hearing on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Defn, Pro se, awaiting appointment of counsel (forwarded to Br. 2 on 9/27/2022)

off the record, Court notes time limits have been waived and defendant does not yet have counsel. Will set for another status.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:35PM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant Glenn McDaniel Sr in court.  Attorney Rebekah Rennicke in court for State of Wisconsin. Court notes the defendants does not yet have counsel but has filed a pro se bail motion. Court gives argument to modify bail to a signature bond. State confirms 950 compliance. State objects to the motion and gives argument. State makes findings and will deny the motion to modify bond at this time.

OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report:  Defn is eligible for SPD services; Counsel has not been appointed yet
Status conference on September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Glenn D McDaniel Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Lilian Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defn applied for SPD and qualified; SPD has not appointed counsel. Colloquy w/ defn RE: time limits for a preliminary hearing. Defn elects to waive time limits. CT finds waiver is knowing, intelligent and voluntary. CT sets for status conference. Bail cont.
Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
SPD appointment of counsel report; Defn is eligible for SPD but no atty has been appointed as of yet

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alex E, Keith S, or Alexandra T.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 7

2:08 PM Defendant Glenn D McDaniel Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Glenn D McDaniel Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Brief adjournment. 2:19 PM Case re-called. Appearance by victim. Statement by victim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
